hostInfo.welcomeMessage:
## The space

Charming, renovated studio with a mezzanine, perfect for two guests seeking a cozy, well-equipped space. The bright living area includes a comfortable sofa, and the open kitchenette is fully equipped, featuring a Nespresso coffee machine, kettle, toaster, and everything you need to cook. There’s a table with two chairs. The mezzanine offers a separate sleeping area with a double bed (140x90 cm); please note the limited ceiling height. The modern bathroom has a shower, a sink with storage, and a toilet. The studio also provides essential household equipment such as a vacuum cleaner, blackout curtains, and some cleaning supplies. A portable fan, mop, and a few cleaning products are also available.

IMPORTANT: NO WIFI, 4G ONLY / NO TV

Linens and Essentials
You’ll find linens and essential items in the apartment upon arrival.

Regarding linens:

The bed will be made according to the number of guests specified in the reservation.
One bath towel per person per stay (bring additional towels if needed).
One kitchen towel, and one bath mat.
Regarding essential items:

Three rolls of toilet paper
Shower gel
Dishwashing liquid & sponge
Coffee pods & tea bags as a welcome gift
A few cleaning supplies
Note: No oil, salt, pepper, paper towels, or laundry detergent are provided.

## Guest access

Guests have full access to the apartment.

## Guest interaction

David and his team manage my apartment.

## Other things to note

We take every precaution to ensure the safety of our guests, following Airbnb’s cleaning protocol by sanitizing frequently touched surfaces (light switches, door handles, furniture handles, remote controls, etc.) before your arrival.

PLEASE NOTE: Only one set of keys is provided per stay, and additional sets are not available.
hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
## The neighborhood

Lyon is famous for its restaurants, from traditional "bouchons Lyonnais" to numerous Michelin-starred establishments. You'll also find many barges along the Rhône offering lovely dining settings.

Located right in the city center, you’ll be surrounded by typical Lyonnais buildings, the large Place des Jacobins, the famous Place Bellecour, and my favorite spot in summer—the Saône Riverbanks, ideal for a stroll in the evening with views of the Medieval Vieux Lyon district and the Basilica of Fourvière.

Favorite Spots: Many to choose from, so don’t hesitate to reach out based on your preferences!

Great Bakeries/Desserts:

Le Pain des Jacobins, delicious and nearby
Boulangerie du Palais, known for praline desserts
Pralus, famous for its praline brioche—highly recommended!
A Few Restaurants and Bars:

La Brasserie Georges: a true institution, known for sauerkraut and craft beers
Café du Rhône: local cuisine with a modern twist in a historic venue
La Madone: bar and apéro platters, with a terrace and regular DJ sets, perfect for football match broadcasts
Abel: for tasting the famous Lyonnais quenelle (reservations recommended)
L’Ourson qui boit: excellent restaurant (reservations also recommended)
Les Muses de l’Opéra: for drinks with a beautiful view atop the Opera building
La Cuisine: traditional cuisine and bar
La Cave des Voyageurs (in Vieux Lyon): wine tasting from small producers with great apéro platters
The barges along the Rhône river, ideal for enjoying a drink on the terraces
More Exotic Options:

Café Lisboa: Portuguese tapas
La Rivière Kwai: Thai cuisine
For Going Out:

La Maison Mère
L'Ambassade
Nearby Cultural Sites:

Musée des Beaux-Arts de Lyon: Just 5 minutes away at 20 Place des Terreaux, with impressive collections from antiquity to contemporary art.
Opéra de Lyon: A 10-minute walk on Place de la Comédie, offering performances from classic opera to contemporary dance.

name: Globe Et Cecil
description:
Located in the heart of the Lyon peninsula between the unmissable Place Bellecour and the majestic Jacobins fountain, the Globe et Cecil is the 4-star establishment you need if you want to explore the city on foot. The hotel offers direct proximity to Old Lyon, museums, shops and public transport (bus, metro, tram, train).

It is a real family home type «boutique hotel» full of charm and history that opens the doors of its 59 rooms (all with unique and authentic decor). Walk through the door in this 19th century building and a whole universe is emerging: a strong identity, antique elements, a singular soul, beautiful design pieces, memories of travelers…

More than a hotel – restaurant, it is a real place of local life where you like to settle down and share beautiful moments with your loved ones (around a coffee, a good meal, a tea time or a well-deserved afterwork).

Need a solo room for a city break? A comfortable cocoon with bath and fireplace or a family room with a view…? Just ask. A homemade breakfast buffet featuring fresh, local produce awaits you every morning at Comptoir Cecil.

Welcome home.Cuplurile apreciază în mod deosebit această locație. I-au dat scorul 9,5 pentru un sejur pentru 2 persoane.Distanța din descrierea proprietății este calculată folosind © OpenStreetMap

hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
## The neighborhood

Lyon is famous for its restaurants: its iconic Lyonnaise bouchons and many Michelin-starred fine dining spots. You'll also find numerous barges on the Rhône offering interesting menus with pleasant dining settings.

In the heart of the city with its typical Lyonnais buildings, the grand Place des Jacobins, the famous Place Bellecour, and my personal favorite in the summer, the Quais de Saône. It's a lovely spot to relax on warm evenings with views of the medieval district of Vieux Lyon and the Basilica of Fourvière.

My favorite spots: There are many!
Depending on your preferences, feel free to contact me!

Best bakeries/desserts:

Le Pain des Jacobins, delicious and just nearby
Boulangerie du Palais, famous for its praline desserts

La Madone: bar with appetizer platters, a nice terrace, and good products, DJs regularly perform. Football matches are shown
Abel: to taste the famous Lyonnaise Quenelle, I recommend booking in advance
L'Ourson qui boit: great restaurant (also needs booking)
Les Muses de l'Opéra: for a drink at the top of the Opera with a magnificent view of Lyon
La Cuisine: traditional cuisine and bar
La Cave des Voyageurs (Vieux Lyon district): wine tasting with small producers, excellent aperitif platters
Les Péniches on the Rhône quays with their terraces for a drink
Exotic spots:

Café Lisboa: Portuguese tapas
La Rivière Kwai: Thai cuisine
For going out:

La Maison Mère
L'Ambassade

hostInfo.welcomeMessage:
The flat is on the 5th floor (no lift), fully furnished and equipped, and has all the facilities to make your stay as pleasant as possible. 

It comprises an entrance hall, a dining area with a table and chairs for 4 people.
A lounge area with a sofa bed for 2 people, a TV, 2 small coffee tables and a Wi-Fi connection throughout the flat.
A fully-equipped open-plan kitchen with fridge, hob, coffee machine, kettle, microwave, oven, dishwasher, toaster and all you need to cook. 
A separate bedroom with a 140x200 bed, ample storage space, wardrobe and shelving for your personal belongings.
A bathroom with bath, towel rail, WC and washing machine.

For your convenience, the flat is ready to welcome you. We provide hotel-quality laundry (bed linen already in place, towels, bath mat, tea towel) as well as 3 welcome kits for the first night / first morning: 1 bathroom kit for 2 people (1 shampoo, 1 shower gel, 1 bar of soap, 3 make-up remover discs, 4 cotton buds, 1 nail file); 1 edible kit for 2 people (2 coffee capsules, 2 tea bags, 2 cocoa pods, 3 sugar pods, 2 mini-cookies); 1 cleaning kit for the stay (1 sponge, 1 washing machine tablet). Included in the cleaning charge.
hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo: Prime location, true city center of the Lyon metropolis, the peninsula offers significant appeal thanks to its monuments, its restaurants, its nightlife and its Haussmann-style architecture. There are a large number of possibilities for activities with the museum of fabrics and decorative arts, the Confluence shopping and leisure center and the Confluences museum. Rue de la République, one of the busiest streets in Lyon, leads to the famous Place Bellecour. Near Perrache train station. An upscale area of ​​the city, you will also find many luxury boutiques and jewelry stores. You will find all amenities, grocery stores, bars, restaurants, etc. nearby.

hostInfo.welcomeMessage:
## The space

This apartment is ideally located in the heart of the city, near Place Bellecour, the largest square in Lyon. It’s right in the center of the Presqu'île, and everything you need is within walking distance—shops, typical Lyonnais restaurants on Rue Mercière and the Quais de Saône, where it's nice to have a drink at sunset, bars, bakeries, and cafes.

The keys can be picked up from the store (located 16 minutes on foot from the apartment).

Nearby, you'll find the Lyon Célestins Theatre, Place Bellecour, the Fontaine des Jacobins, the Museum of Printing and Graphic Communication, the Saint-Nizier Church, the Grand Hôtel-Dieu, and the quays of the Rhône with bars on boats.

The apartment is on the 3rd floor, with an elevator, and then a few steps up.

The apartment boasts a beautiful view of the rooftops of Lyon, overlooking an interior courtyard, so you won’t be disturbed by the noise of the city or traffic. The windows are equipped with blinds and blackout curtains for your late mornings.

The apartment accommodates 4 people with a double bed and a sofa bed.

The apartment includes the following amenities:

A living area with a small sofa, a three-seat sofa that converts into a double bed, and a dining table
A kitchenette equipped with a microwave, refrigerator, cooktop, kettle, toaster, dishes, and kitchen utensils. Note: Coffee machine is a filter coffee machine.
An open bedroom area with a double bed
A shower room with a basin and toilet
A washing machine
Linens and Basic Products
Upon arrival, you will find linens and basic products provided:

Linens:

The bed will be made up according to the number of people listed in the reservation
1 bath towel per person for the stay (please bring extras if needed)
1 dish towel and 1 bath mat
Basic products:

3 toilet rolls
1 shower gel
1 dish soap & 1 sponge
Coffee capsules & tea bags offered upon arrival
Some cleaning products
Note: No oil, salt, pepper, or paper towels. No laundry detergent.

hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
## The neighborhood

Lyon is famous for its restaurants: the famous Lyonnais "bouchons" and many Michelin-starred gastronomic restaurants. You will also find numerous boats on the Rhône offering interesting menus where you can dine in a pleasant setting.

In the city center, with its typical Lyonnais buildings, you’ll find the large Place des Jacobins, the famous Place Bellecour, and my favorite spot in the summer, the Quais de Saône, which are lovely when it’s warm in the evening, with views of the medieval district of Old Lyon and the Basilica of Fourvière.

Some of my favorite addresses:

Delicious bakeries/desserts:

Le Pain des Jacobins, delicious and just next door
Boulangerie du Palais, known for its praline desserts
Pralus: the famous praline brioche, highly recommended!
Typical restaurants and bars:

La Brasserie Georges: A true institution, known for its sauerkraut and craft beers
Le Café du Rhône: Traditional local cuisine, with a beautiful setting
La Madone: A bar with appetizers and a pleasant terrace; DJ performances and football match broadcasts
Abel: To taste the famous Lyonnais Quenelle, it’s recommended to book in advance
L'Ourson qui Boit: Excellent restaurant (reservation needed)
Les Muses de l'Opéra: For drinks at the top of the Opera House, with a stunning view of Lyon
La Cuisine: Traditional cuisine and bar
La Cave des Voyageurs (Old Lyon district): Wine tasting, small producers, great appetizers
The boats along the quays of the Rhône, with their terraces for a drink
Exotic spots:

Café Lisboa: Portuguese tapas
La Rivière Kwai: Thai cuisine
For a night out:

La Maison Mère
L'Ambassade

## Getting around

The apartment is very well served by metro, bus, bike, and is only 2 minutes walk to Place Bellecour.

From Gare Part-Dieu to the apartment:
Take bus C9 direction Bellecour Le Viste and get off at Bellecour Le Viste. The apartment is 5 minutes on foot.

From St Exupéry Airport to the apartment:
Take the Rhône Express to Part-Dieu station, t...

hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
## The neighborhood

Lyon is famed for its dining scene, with its traditional bouchons and many Michelin-starred restaurants. Along the Rhône riverbanks, find numerous péniches (riverboats) offering delightful menus in a unique setting.

In the heart of Lyon, the 2nd arrondissement boasts classic architecture, with landmarks like Place des Jacobins, the iconic Place Bellecour, and the scenic Saône riverbanks, perfect for evening strolls with views of Vieux Lyon and the Basilica of Fourvière.

Recommended spots nearby:

Bakeries/Desserts:

Le Pain des Jacobins: Delicious and close by.
Boulangerie du Palais: Known for praline desserts.
Pralus: Try their famous praline brioche!
Restaurants and Bars:

Brasserie Georges: An institution famous for its sauerkraut and artisanal beers.
Café du Rhône: Traditional, local cuisine in a historic setting.
Abel: For Lyon’s renowned quenelle dish.
L'Ourson qui boit: Excellent, reservation recommended.
The Opera Rooftop: Enjoy drinks with views over Lyon.
Les Péniches on the Rhône: Terraces with drinks by the river.
International options:

Café Lisboa: Portuguese tapas
La Rivière Kwai: Thai cuisine
Nightlife:

Maison Mère
L'Ambassade
Nearby cultural sites:

Lyon Fine Arts Museum (5 min): Renowned collections from ancient to contemporary art.
Lyon Opera (10 min): Hosts classic and contemporary performances.
Vieux Lyon - Saint-Jean (15 min): Discover cobbled streets, artisanal shops, and cozy cafés.
Gadagne Museum: Unveils Lyon’s history through engaging exhibits.

## Getting around

Well-served by metro, bus, bike rentals, and a short 5-minute walk to Place Bellecour.

From Part-Dieu Station:
Take Metro B towards St Genis Laval, stop at Saxe Gambetta, then take Metro D towards Gare de Vaise, and exit at Bellecour (5 min walk to apartment).

From St Exupéry Airport:
Take the Rhône Xpress to Vaulx-en-Velin la Soie, then Metro A towards Perrache, and exit at Bellecour (5 min walk).

hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
## The neighborhood

Lyon is famous for its restaurants: its iconic Lyonnaise bouchons and many Michelin-starred fine dining spots. You'll also find numerous barges on the Rhône offering interesting menus with pleasant dining settings.

In the heart of the city with its typical Lyonnais buildings, the grand Place des Jacobins, the famous Place Bellecour, and my personal favorite in the summer, the Quais de Saône. It's a lovely spot to relax on warm evenings with views of the medieval district of Vieux Lyon and the Basilica of Fourvière.

My favorite spots: There are many!
Depending on your preferences, feel free to contact me!

Best bakeries/desserts:

Le Pain des Jacobins, delicious and just nearby
Boulangerie du Palais, famous for its praline desserts
Pralus: the famous praline brioche, highly recommended!
Some typical restaurants and bars:

La Brasserie Georges: a true institution, known for its sauerkraut and craft beers
Café du Rhône: bar and traditional local cuisine, the place is rated
La Madone: bar with appetizer platters, a nice terrace, and good products, DJs regularly perform. Football matches are shown
Abel: to taste the famous Lyonnaise Quenelle, I recommend booking in advance
L'Ourson qui boit: great restaurant (also needs booking)
Les Muses de l'Opéra: for a drink at the top of the Opera with a magnificent view of Lyon
La Cuisine: traditional cuisine and bar
La Cave des Voyageurs (Vieux Lyon district): wine tasting with small producers, excellent aperitif platters
Les Péniches on the Rhône quays with their terraces for a drink
Exotic spots:

Café Lisboa: Portuguese tapas
La Rivière Kwai: Thai cuisine
For going out:

La Maison Mère
L'Ambassade
Cultural places within walking distance:

Musée des Beaux-Arts de Lyon: just 5 minutes from your location, this museum hosts an impressive collection of works from antiquity to contemporary art.
Opéra de Lyon: 10 minutes' walk, on Place de la Comédie, offering various performances from classical opera to cont...

hostInfo.name: GuestReady
hostInfo.welcomeMessage:
Welcome to my apartment!

This beautifully designed 100m2 two-bedroom apartment in Lyon is the perfect retreat for families and friends seeking comfort and convenience.

Located on the 1st floor and accessible by stairs, the apartment boasts an open floor plan featuring a living room with a comfortable double sofa bed and a  TV for your entertainment. There's also a private balcony to enjoy the fresh air and add a touch of outdoor relaxation to your stay.

The fully equipped kitchenette includes essential cookware and appliances such as a stove, and an oven.

Both bedrooms are furnished with double beds with complimentary hotel-quality linens and multiple storage spaces.

The bathroom is stocked with clean towels, a hair dryer, and complimentary toiletries.

The apartment is always professionally cleaned for your comfort.

Enjoy your stay!
hostInfo.ownerInfo: At GuestReady, we're on a mission to redefine modern hospitality. We specialise in helping hosts deliver outstanding experiences to their guests worldwide. With years of hospitality experience, we're dedicated to providing an exceptional experience. Let us help you find the perfect place for an unforgettable stay!
hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
Situated in the heart of Lyon's Presqu'île district, the property offers an ideal location for exploring the city's rich history and vibrant culture. At the centre of this area is Place Bellecour, one of Europe’s largest public squares, home to the iconic equestrian statue of Louis XIV. During winter, visitors can enjoy breathtaking panoramic views of the city from a towering 60-meter Ferris wheel.

Just a short stroll from the square, Rue de la République and Rue Victor Hugo extend with an array of shops, boutiques, and cafés, creating the perfect setting for a leisurely shopping experience. A few steps away, the Théâtre des Célestins, an architectural masterpiece dating back to the 18th century, hosts diverse theatrical performances in an elegant setting.

Crossing the Saône River leads to Vieux Lyon (Old Lyon), a Renaissance district known for its cobblestone streets, charming traboules (hidden passageways), and historical landmarks such as the Lyon Cathedral (Cathédrale St-Jean). For those seeking a panoramic view of the city, the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière, perched atop Fourvière Hill, is easily accessible via a scenic walk or funicular ride from Vieux Lyon.

Enjoy easy access to Place Bellecour, the Westfield La Part-Dieu shopping center, and the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière. Whether you're visiting for tourism, business, or an extended stay, this apartment offers a pleasant setting in the heart of the city.

📍 Located in a sought-after neighborhood in Lyon’s 1st arrondissement, the apartment is close to public transport (metro, bus), numerous shops, traditional cafés and restaurants, and the city's main points of interest. Don’t miss the Jardin des Curiosités, located less than 10 minutes away by car.

📍 The apartment includes:

📍 Living space
✔️ A cozy living room with a sofa bed, coffee table, TV, desk, and storage
✔️ A fully equipped open kitchen: stovetop, extractor hood, oven, microwave, refrigerator, dishwasher, washing machine, coffee maker, kettle, toaster, kitchen utensils
✔️ A first bedroom with a queen-size bed, TV with DVD player, and storage
✔️ A second bedroom with a queen-size bed and desk
✔️ A bathroom with shower, sink, and toilet
✔️ A terrace with outdoor furniture, accessible from the kitchen

📍 Highlights of this apartment:
📶 High-speed Wi-Fi included
🧺 Hotel-quality bed linen and towels provided
🌆 Close to Place Bellecour, and less than 20 minutes by car from La Part-Dieu and the Basilica of Fourvière
🚇 Easy access to public transportation (metro, bus)
🛍️ Near shops, restaurants, and lively Lyon spots.
hostInfo.neighboorhoodInfo:
Located in a lively and central area of Lyon’s 1st arrondissement, just a 12-minute walk from Place Bellecour, this apartment offers a pleasant and convenient living environment. This neighborhood combines historic charm and vibrant local life, with quick access to public transportation — perfect for discovering Lyon with ease. You’ll find many nearby shops, artisan bakeries, traditional restaurants, and welcoming cafés.

You’ll be able to easily explore several tourist attractions such as the Presqu’île and its shopping streets, the Westfield La Part-Dieu shopping center, the Jardin des Curiosités (less than 10 minutes by car), the Saône riverbanks for a scenic stroll, or the Basilica of Notre-Dame de Fourvière. This neighborhood perfectly embodies the Lyon lifestyle: cultural, vibrant, and welcoming.

Here are our restaurant recommendations in Lyon:

🍴 L’Établi – A cozy and creative spot offering local and seasonal cuisine in a warm setting


🍴 Le Dandelion – Café – Restaurant Lyon 2 – A modern and refined venue serving homemade dishes made with fresh ingredients


🍴 Brasserie Georges – A Lyon institution offering generous, traditional French cuisine in a unique Art Deco setting
